body:
Thanks, fixed.

Here's the updated link.
http://mynodebtc.com/device/mynode_images/raspi3_final.img.gz

There are two options.

First, you could purchase myNode Premium [https://mynodebtc.com/order_now](here) and upgrade via a single click on the settings page.

Second, you can upgrade via developer tools by following the developer instructions in the README.
https://github.com/mynodebtc/mynode#developing-for-mynode

If you have any issues, please open another issue.

Sorry, but I'm not sure I understand the question. Both the Bitcoin and LND configs are pre-configured to run via Tor.

Are you having an issue running either Bitcoin or LND?
Ok this is just my misunderstanding, thanks.
It would be relatively easy to support, but I don't have the hardware for testing a Rock64Pro. So, I don't have any short term plans to support it, sorry.

I don't have any current plans to support Dojo. I had looked into it and the device requirements are a little too high.

However, you can use Samourai wallet with myNode by adding it as a trusted node. I'll work on adding a guide.

@rhst1 This has been added and is available on the Settings page in the latest version.

http://mynodebtc.com/guide/upgrading_your_device

Download page only has version 1.43

Where is 1.46?

 

From: Taylor Helsper <notifications@github.com> 
Sent: Friday, September 20, 2019 11:48 AM
To: mynodebtc/mynode <mynode@noreply.github.com>
Cc: rhst1 <rhstone@wakarusariver.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [mynodebtc/mynode] Shutdown Raspberry Pi from GUI (#7)

 

@rhst1 <https://github.com/rhst1>  This has been added and is available on the Settings page in the latest version.

http://mynodebtc.com/guide/upgrading_your_device

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/mynodebtc/mynode/issues/7?email_source=notifications&email_token=ANIFOSELA6HDCI4Y6EWSAY3QKT5CLA5CNFSM4IYZERCKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOD7HISHI#issuecomment-533629213> , or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ANIFOSD2YJJN55QOT2AMDP3QKT5CLANCNFSM4IYZERCA> .

You can upgrade manually by using the GitHub project. See:
https://github.com/mynodebtc/mynode#developing-for-mynode

Otherwise, you can purchase the premium edition and upgrade by clicking the upgrade button on the Setting page.
https://mynodebtc.com/order/premium

Yes, that is too long. Have you tried rebooting?

The status is generated by parsing log files and I have noticed that logrotate can cause the log files to have issues.

To check the real status, try "systemctl status electrs" and post the output.

Here’s the response:

Yes, that is too long. Have you tried rebooting?

The status is generated by parsing log files and I have noticed that logrotate can cause the log files to have issues.

To check the real status, try "systemctl status electrs" and post the output.

admin@myNode:~ $ systemctl status electrs

● electrs.service - myNode Electrum Server

   Loaded: loaded (/etc/systemd/system/electrs.service; enabled; vendor preset: enabled)

   Active: activating (auto-restart) (Result: exit-code) since Wed 2019-10-02 19:27:32 CDT; 10s ago

  Process: 5313 ExecStartPre=/usr/bin/wait_on_bitcoin.sh (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)

  Process: 5315 ExecStart=/usr/bin/electrs --timestamp --db-dir /mnt/hdd/mynode/electrs --electrum-r

Main PID: 5315 (code=exited, status=203/EXEC)
